avalancheActivity.comment: A small slab avalanche was spotted in Bláfjöll 22.2. along with a few small sluffs and collapsed cornices.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Rather little dry snow is on top of stable snow that went through thaw early this week. Between them may be weaknesses.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow subsided and melted in thaw since Saturday. This old snow is expected to be generally homogeneous and stable most places. If should stiffen and strengthen even more in cold temperatures. The little new dry snow on top may bond poorly with underlying hardpacked snow. An extended column test in Bláfjöll 12.2. gave a fracture that propagated at medium additional load on a slush layer between stiffer slabs. In these conditions, large avalanches are not expected but gullies and depressions that have gathered much new snow can be dangerous.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow melted in thawing early this week. New dry snow is not on top of it and some unstable wind slabs could have formed or weak layers between the two snow types. A lot of snow has been falling in the north throughout the day and is expected to continue throughout Saturday. Beware of steep hills the first days after new snow has fallen.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow melted in thawing early this week. New dry snow is not on top of it and some unstable wind slabs could have formed or weak layers between the two snow types.

weatherForecast.highlights: Úrkomulítið næstu daga og kólnar um helgina.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many small avalanches released in Kirkjubólshlíð, probably in the rain the night before Wednesday 20.2. The largest avalanche stopped 50 m above the road. Small sluffs released in the area in warm weather and sunshine last weekend.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow that fell after Wednesday may have formed unstable wind slabs on top of stiff and generally stable snow, especially in S-W aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The weather was warm from Saturday to Tuesday and the snow subsided and partly melted. Weak layers in the snowpack seem to have gained strength and the old snow should now be generally stiff and stable. New snow that fell in the second half of the week, especially on Thursday, and drifted in strong NE winds can however have formed new unstable wind slabs on top, especially in S-W aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow melted in thawing early this week. New dry snow is not on top of it and some unstable wind slabs could have formed or weak layers between the two snow types. A lot of snow has been falling in the north throughout the day and is expected to continue throughout Saturday. Beware of steep hills the first days after new snow has fallen.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow melted in thawing early this week. New dry snow is not on top of it and some unstable wind slabs could have formed or weak layers between the two snow types.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA-snjókoma og skafrenningur fram yfir miðnætti á fimmtudagskvöld. Éljar aðeins áfram á föstudag og blæs úr NA. Dregur úr úrkomu og vindi með kvöldinu og bætir í frost. Kalt og þurrt um helgina.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small slab avalanches released on Thursday morning in intense snowfall in easy NW-winds. Several more were added when the wind turned to strong NNE with sleet and rain at sealevel. 300 m wide slab in Burstabrekkudalur was spotted 19.2. which has likely been triggered by the warming on 18.2.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Intense snowfall in easy NW-winds on Thursday morning but in the afternoon strong NNA winds with sleet or rain at sealevel triggered a few slabs. It kept on snowing in the mountains during the afternoon in strong NNA winds

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow has settled in the warming during the weekend but still a weak layer is persistent. Stability tests in Skarðsdalur 17.2. showed quite easy propagation on the interface to the uppermost ice layer in the snowpack. Little snow was added in a short period of NA-winds on Wednesday morning. On Thursday morningin we had itense snowfall in easy NW-winds but in the afternoon strong NNA winds with sleet or rain at sealevel

A lot of snow has been falling in the north throughout the day and is expected to continue throughout Saturday. Beware of steep hills the first days after new snow has fallen.

weatherForecast.highlights: N-NA hraglandi með éljum fram á laugardagskvöld

avalancheActivity.comment: A slab avalanche released in Skagafell in Fagridalur 18/2 and wet loose avalanches released in Norðfjörður. Sowmobile triggered an avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður 14/2.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow that fell on Wednesday may have formed new unstable wind slabs, especially in W-N aspects

snowpackStructure.highlights: Older snow subsided in warm weather in the first half of the week and weak layers gained strength. Older snow should now be generally stiff and stable. Snow added in mountains on Wednesday and drifted in S-E winds. New unstable wind slabs may have formed in leesides and gullies, on top of the old snow. On Friday, snow is forecasted to add in NW winds. Wind slabs may then form in more aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow melted in thawing early this week. New dry snow is not on top of it and some unstable wind slabs could have formed or weak layers between the two snow types. A lot of snow has been falling in the north throughout the day and is expected to continue throughout Saturday. Beware of steep hills the first days after new snow has fallen.
